page.content: water with an oily scum. He complained to the Rivers Division of the North West Water Authority as he feared the consequences for wildlife. Though no investigation had been carried out by the Water Authority an investigator had visited Hattersley's site and told them to improve the drainage. A Hattersley spokesman said the matter had only recently come to their attention and they had taken immediate action. After consultation with the Water Authority, it was agreed that Hattersley's would build a retaining wall around the diesel storage tank to prevent the risk of oil seepage. Councillor Barker wants a monitoring system to identify all pollution sources. Our group feel this is an important issue and we hope that in years to come fish will return.
